        $('#tell-me-more').click(function () {
            var clickSource = $("body").attr("class") + '-mini';
            if ($("body").hasClass("questions-page")) {
                clickSource = 'questionpagemini';
            }
            if ($("body").hasClass("home-page")) {
                clickSource = 'homepagemini';
            }

            StackExchange.using("gps", function () {
                StackExchange.gps.track("aboutpage.click", { aboutclick_location: clickSource } , true);
            });
        });
        $('#herobox-mini #close').click(function () {
            StackExchange.using("gps", function () {
                StackExchange.gps.track("hero.action", { hero_action_type: "close" }, true);
            });
            $.cookie("hero", "none", { path: "/" });
            var $hero = $("#herobox-mini");
            $hero.slideUp('fast', function () { $hero.remove(); });
            return false;
        });
    </script>

			<!--googleon: all-->
			<div id="question-header">
			<h1 itemprop="name"><a href="/questions/19141132/spy-32-and-64-bit-doesnt-allow-for-both-to-run-simultaneously-why" class="question-hyperlink">Spy++ 32 and 64 bit doesn&#39;t allow for both to run simultaneously. Why?</a></h1>
		</div>
			<div id="mainbar">

			

<div class="question" data-questionid="19141132"  id="question">
    
                <script type="text/javascript">
                var ados = ados || {};ados.run = ados.run || [];
                ados.run.push(function() { ados_add_placement(22,8277,"adzerk428881240",4).setZone(43) ; });                    
            </script>
            <div class="everyonelovesstackoverflow" id="adzerk428881240">
            </div>  


    <table>
        <tr>
            <td class="votecell">
                

<div class="vote">
    <input type="hidden" name="_id_" value="19141132">
    <a class="vote-up-off" title="This question shows research effort; it is useful and clear">up vote</a>
    <span class="vote-count-post ">0</span>
    <a class="vote-down-off" title="This question does not show any research effort; it is unclear or not useful">down vote</a>
    
    <a class="star-off" href="#" title="This is a favorite question (click again to undo)">favorite</a>
    <div class="favoritecount"><b></b></div>   

</div>

            </td>
            
<td class="postcell">
<div>
    <div class="post-text" itemprop="description">

        <p>I'm debugging a 32 bit port to 64 bit platform.  There's a bug causing issues with one of the windows not responding to a message properly on the 64 bit version only.  So I run them side by side and tried to use Spy++ on them.</p>

<p>Turns out that you can't use Spy++ 32 on a 64 bit application and vice versa.  Also turns out that you can't run both Spy++ 32 and 64 bit versions simultaneously.</p>

<p>What's this all about and how can I get around this issue.  Is there an equivalent that would intercept messages on both 32 and 64 bit versions?</p>

    </div>
    <div class="post-taglist">
        <a href="/questions/tagged/winapi" class="post-tag" title="show questions tagged 'winapi'" rel="tag">winapi</a> <a href="/questions/tagged/messages" class="post-tag" title="show questions tagged 'messages'" rel="tag">messages</a> 
    </div>
    <table class="fw">
    <tr>
    <td class="vt">











<div class="post-menu"><a href="/q/19141132" title="short permalink to this question" class="short-link" id="link-post-19141132">share</a><span class="lsep">|</span><a href="/posts/19141132/edit" class="suggest-edit-post" title="">improve this question</a></div>        
    </td>
    <td class="post-signature owner">
        

    <div class="user-info ">
        <div class="user-action-time">
            

                    asked <span title="2013-10-02 15:48:57Z" class="relativetime">14 mins ago</span>
        </div>

        </div>
    </div>

<a href="/q/8997216" title="Vote score (upvotes - downvotes)">
        <div class="answer-votes default">24</div>
</a>

</div>

        <div class="answer-votes answered-accepted default">4</div>

        var ssl='https:'==document.location.protocol,
            s=document.getElementsByTagName('script')[0],
            ga=document.createElement('script');

        ga.async=true;
        ga.src=(ssl?'https://ssl':'http://www')+'.google-analytics.com/ga.js';
